title: How to Pay Bills with Your PayPal Account on Web or Mobile

steps.title: Log into PayPal.
steps.content: Log into PayPal . Enter your email address or phone number and password. You should see your account summary.

steps.title: Click ⋮ More.
steps.content: Click ⋮ More . This is at the top-right of the page, underneath the Send and Request buttons.

steps.title: Click Pay your bills.
steps.content: Click Pay your bills . This is in the drop-down menu. If you don't see this option, you may already have the icon in your recents. Click Pay bills underneath the Send and Request buttons. You may be asked to log in again or verify your account to proceed.

steps.title: Enter the company you want to pay.
steps.content: Enter the company you want to pay. Not all companies are available through this search feature. You can also use the category tiles to browse for companies. Be aware of false PayPal accounts pretending to be companies.

steps.title: Enter details from your bill.
steps.content: Enter details from your bill. Depending on the service or company, you will need to confirm different details. You may be asked to provide an Account Number , ZIP code , Name , or other identifying information.

steps.title: Click Add Your Bill.
steps.content: Click Add Your Bill . Once your bill is added, you'll be able to keep track of bills and due dates from the PayPal app.

steps.title: Pay a bill.
steps.content: Pay a bill. When a payment is due, do the following: Log into PayPal. Click ⋮ More . Click Pay your bills . Click Pay next to the biller's name. Review the bill details. Click Pay . Select a payment method. Click Send Payment or Schedule Payment .

steps.title: Open the PayPal mobile app.
steps.content: Open the PayPal mobile app. This is the white P icon with a blue background. [1] X Research source PayPal is available for iOS in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store . If you aren't already signed in, tap enter your login details and tap Sign in to do so now. You must have an account to use PayPal .

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . This is in the top-left corner. A new page will open.

steps.title: Tap Pay bills.
steps.content: Tap Pay bills . You can find this under the Send and pay header. You may need to scroll down to find this option.

steps.title: Tap the magnifying glass icon.
steps.content: Tap the magnifying glass icon. This is above Search by name .

steps.title: Enter the company you want to pay.
steps.content: Enter the company you want to pay. Not all companies are available through this search feature. [2] X Research source If the company does not appear, you will need to log directly into the company website to use PayPal as a payment method. Be aware of false PayPal accounts pretending to be companies.

steps.title: Tap the company.
steps.content: Tap the company. You may be asked to log in again or verify your account to proceed.

steps.title: Enter details from your bill.
steps.content: Enter details from your bill. Depending on the service or company, you will need to confirm different details. You may be asked to provide an Account Number , ZIP code , Name , or other identifying information.

steps.title: Tap Add Your Bill.
steps.content: Tap Add Your Bill . Once your bill is added, you'll be able to keep track of bills and due dates from the PayPal app. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Pay a bill.
steps.content: Pay a bill. When a payment is due, do the following: Tap ☰ . Tap Pay bills . Tap the biller's name. Tap Pay .

steps.title: Go to your service provider's website.
steps.content: Go to your service provider's website. You can use a mobile or desktop browser such as Google Chrome , Safari, Mozilla Firefox , or another browser. As long as the company you want to pay accepts PayPal payments, you can use the service to pay your bill through that service. [4] X Research source For example, you can opt to use PayPal as your payment method for Comcast Xfinity. This is a process you have to set up on the biller's site (e.g., Xfinity.com if you're paying Xfinity), not on PayPal's website. You'll need to set up a PayPal account if you haven't already.

steps.title: Log into your account.
steps.content: Log into your account. You might have a username set up with your provider, but you might also use an email address instead of a username.

steps.title: Locate the Billing or Payments area of the website.
steps.content: Locate the Billing or Payments area of the website. The name of this section varies by provider, but you're looking for the part of your account page where you can schedule a payment.

steps.title: Select PayPal as your payment method.
steps.content: Select PayPal as your payment method. Some providers, like Xfinity, allow you to set up recurring payments using your default payment method. Depending on the service, you may have the option to set up recurring automatic payments through PayPal. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Confirm the payment.
steps.content: Confirm the payment. You'll receive an email with a link to your account settings in PayPal if you want to cancel the payment. If you're using the PayPal app on your phone or tablet, you can also opt into push notifications from the PayPal app so you'll be alerted whenever money comes out of your account. [6] X Research source You can also use PayPal to pay others .

steps.title: Get a PayPal Debit Card.
steps.content: Get a PayPal Debit Card. If your billing provider doesn't accept PayPal as a payment method but does accept debit cards, you can sign up for a free PayPal debit card. This will allow you to pay with your PayPal balance anywhere that Mastercard is accepted. To get your PayPal card: Go to [7] X Research source and click Get The Card . Follow the on-screen instructions to order your card. When the card comes in the mail, go to [8] X Research source and sign in. Click Activate and follow the on-screen information to complete the activation. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Go to your service provider's website.
steps.content: Go to your service provider's website. As long as your service provider accepts Mastercard credit or debit cards, you can use your new PayPal card to pay your bill.

steps.title: Log into your account.
steps.content: Log into your account. You might have a username set up with your provider, but you might also use an email address instead of a username.

steps.title: Enter your PayPal Card information as your payment method.
steps.content: Enter your PayPal Card information as your payment method. Enter this info just as you would any other credit or debit card to process your payment. Set up recurring payments if it's an option. If you don't want to need to do this every time the bill is due, you could possibly have the chance to remember and use this card for future payments.
